author: Special Correspondent
text:
The 23-year-old was talking to her family on the phone when the incident occurred

A 23-year-old graduate died in Bengaluru on Tuesday when at least three concrete hollow bricks fell from the second floor of an under-construction building.

Engineering student Mounika Reddy, who had completed a round of interviews with tech giant Infosys, was killed on its J.P. Nagar campus. She was talking to her parents and updating them about the interview when the incident took place. Ms Reddy had travelled from her hometown in Chittoor, Andhra Pradesh, for the interview.

She had successfully completed one round of interviews, and left the building to call her parents to give them an update. She was standing beneath an under-construction building in the J.P. Nagar Infosys campus, and talking to her family on her mobile phone when the bricks fell on her head.

The incident took place around 12.30 p.m.

According to the police, she stepped out of the office building to hear her parents more clearly.

She sustained severe head injuries and collapsed, bleeding profusely. Eyewitnesses with the help of her relative Rama Reddy, who had accompanied Mounika for the interview, rushed her to NIMHANS, where she succumbed to her injuries.

In an email statement, Infosys said: “We are saddened by the unfortunate incident that took place at our campus on Bannerghatta Road this morning. We extend our deepest sympathies to the victim’s family and will provide them all necessary support in their hour of grief. We are also working with the authorities as they investigate the matter.”

Mounika Reddy had come from Chittoor, Andhra Pradesh, for an interview at Infosys
title: Tech job aspirant dies after bricks fall on her head
